item.title: Report E-2025010094
item.description:
Report E-2025010094

Identified by scraper @ 2025-01-12T03:40:19+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2025-01-08
  • City: LEXINGTON
  • State: KY
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: DAYTON FREIGHT LINES, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: Dayton Freight personnel observed approximately ten (10) gallons of material released from one (1) 55-gallon metal drum due to the drum being punctured while loading other freight. The released material impacted the trailer floor. Dayton Freight personnel deployed granular absorbents to the impacted area and gathered the spent material and containerized it into one (1) 85-gallon poly drum. An additional one (1) 85-gallon poly drum contains the punctured 55-gallon metal drum. The generated waste was staged onsite at the terminal in a secure location. The generated waste will remain onsite for Dayton Freightâ€™s contracted hazardous waste vendor to coordinate disposal.

  • Description: On January 6, 2025, five (5) 5-gallon pails of paint were damaged and released approximately ten (10) gallons of paint to the trailer interior. R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services, LC who dispatched a crew from Environmental Works, Inc. (EWI) to remediate the impacted site. The crew utilized absorbents and hand tools to remediate the site. All impacted materials and the damaged pails were containerized in three (3) 55-gallon drums for disposal.

No other packages were damaged. No injuries occurred during the spill.

  • Description: On January 3, 2024, five (5) 5-gallon pails of paint were damaged in transit and released approximately one (1) gallon of product to the trailer interior. R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services, LC who dispatched a crew from Green Site Services Group, Inc. (GSSG) to remediate the impacted site. The crew utilized absorbents and hand tools to remediate the site. The impacted pallet was dismantled. All impacted materials were containerized in two (2) 55-gallon drums for disposal.

  • Description: During sort operations at the SATR location a fiberboard box with signs of a release was discovered. It contained six plastic bottles and one had a loose cap causing the release. The plastic bottles were packaged with packing paper for dunnage. While investigating the shipment the spill agent found a SDS inside of the box stating the contents were UN1805. There were no DG markings or paperwork required for transport on the outer fiberboard box. The shipment was placed into a steel salvage package and is being held at the location.

It was reported that approximately 5 gallons of Q1 Enzian Blue Satin Urethane released from one 5-gallon metal pale due to forklift puncture. The release impacted trailer #3115279. Call Center reviewed the SDS with the caller and determined that terminal personnel are capable of cleaning the release with PPE available on site. Waste label 223391-1 was created, one 95-gallon poly drum containing one 5-gallon pale, oil dri, protective gloves, goggles, and plastic wrap. Chemtrec has been notified, report number 2024121300075 was given by Alex.

  • Description: At 0419 ET, NCH notified ERTS of a cargo release located on their dock. It was reported 1 pound of lithium hydroxide released from 2 50-pound paper bags due to forklift puncture. ERTS reviewed the SDS with the caller and recommended a contractor be sent out due to being a hazard class 8. The caller reported the terminal will clean the release with PPE on site and place the spill along with the 2 damaged bags inside of a 55-gallon poly drum. Carechem was notified of the release and report #18879 was provided.

  • Description: At 19:35 EST on 12/12, Dan with XPO-XSB contacted ERTS to report a spill of about 10 gallons of "ACTIVATOR" from 2x 5gal metal pails impacting the trailer and dock floors. The pails were punctured by a forklift at XSB. ERTS reviewed the SDS with the caller and recommended a contractor assist with additional PPE, citing goggles. Placed the (2) 5-gallon pails in 55-gallon metal drum and staged for terminal management to handle.

  • Description: At 1946 ET, XPO notified ERTS of a cargo release at UVG. It was reported that approximately 1/2 gallon of Zep Acidic Toilet Bowl Cleaner released from 1-gallon plastic jugs due to improper loading by terminal UCU. The release impacted the inside of a small plastic carrier bin in trailer # 3213389. ERTS will proceed to dispatch a contractor to the site to complete cleanup activities. An ETA will be provided once it is known. Called Chemtrec and spoke to Esther. Report #20241201200198. ERTS called Trenton back and he explained that the damaged box is by itself on the plastic carrier bin. He said the bin isn't something that they would need to salvage, and he has no problem disposing it. ERTS advised that since the product is contained to the bin, terminal personnel can place the bin in a 55-gallon poly waste drum themselves.

  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: EnviroMark was dispatched to the site. Upon the contractorâ€™s arrival, personnel observed that the released material impacted two areas measuring approximately 50ft-by-10ft of the trailer floor and 20ft-by-2ft of the soil beyond the shoulder and estimated that fifty (50) gallons of material was released due to a single vehicle accident that resulted in one (1) 55-gallon metal drum. EnviroMark personnel deployed granular absorbent to the impacted areas and gathered the spent absorbents and containerized the recovered material into six (6) 55-gallon metal drums. The damaged drum and two other impacted drums were overpacked into three (3) 95-gallon poly drums. The generated waste was transported offsite for disposal.

  • Description: On December 27, 2024, eight (8) 5-gallon pails of paint were crushed and released approximately six (6) gallons of product to the trailer interior and surrounding freight. R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services, LC who dispatched a crew from Ten West Environmental (TWE) to remediate the impacted site. TWE utilized cleaners and absorbent pads to remove all released paint. All waste was containerized in three (3) 55-gallon drums for disposal.

  • Description: Dayton Freight personnel observed approximately one (1) pint of material released from one (1) 55-gallon metal drum due to a nail in the trailer that resulted in the drum being punctured. The released material impacted the trailer floor. Dayton Freight personnel deployed granular absorbents to the impacted area and gathered the spent material and containerized it into one (1) 65-gallon poly drum. The generated waste was staged onsite at the terminal in a secure location. The generated waste will remain onsite for Dayton Freightâ€™s contracted hazardous waste vendor to coordinate disposal.

item.title: Report E-2025010070
item.description:
Report E-2025010070

Identified by scraper @ 2025-01-08T18:17:50+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-12-20
  • City: HEBRON
  • State: KY
  • Report Type: Undeclared Shipment with no Release
  • Mode Of Transportation: Air
  • Carrier/Reporter: Sun Country Airlines
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: FEAM CVG currently operates as contract maintenance for Sun Country Airlines at the CVG airport. On 12/20/2024 Sun Country maintenance control reached out to a FEAM employee to request that a non-hazardous material aircraft part be shipped back to MSP that night as COMAT on board flight 3039 and A/C N7907A. Without the knowledge or consultation of any Sun Country employee the FEAM employee also loaded a single portable halon fire extinguisher (UN1044) which was not declared as hazmat. This undeclared hazmat COMAT was subsequently onboard A/C N7907A for flight 3039 from CVG to MSP. Upon arrival in MSP this hazmat was discovered, and the discrepancy became known. There was no package failure or release of material during this event and the undeclared hazmat package was removed from the aircraft without further incident. Actions taken after this event included reaching out to the contract maintenance provider to remind them any shipping of items as COMAT needs to be communicated too and cleared by the Sun Country materials department. An internal investigation was also launched along with the filing of an FAA hazmat cargo discrepancy report and an FAA VDRP related to the regulatory violation that occurred.

Inside of the fiberboard box was a five gallon plastic bucket and the lid opened up spilling the contents. The spill agent found a SDS inside of the box but it was covered with the spilled contents. They observed that the contents smelled and looked like paint. The shipment was placed into a steel salvage package and is being held at the location.

item.description:

  • Incident Date: 2025-01-03
  • City: WILMINGTON
  • State: OH
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: R & L CARRIERS, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 5000
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: On January 3, 2024, one (1) 55-gallon drum of printing ink was forked and released approximately 55-gallons to the dodck floor. R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services, LC who dispatched crews from First Call Environmental (FCE) and Thin Line Environmental (TLE) to remediate the impacted site. R+L deployed absorbents prior to their arrival. FCE utilized hand tools to collect the absorbents. All UN1210 impacted material was collected and containerized in one (1) 85-gallon drum, one (1) 55-gallon drum, and four (4) 95-gallon overpacks. TLE personnel aided in transferring all non-damaged product to new, undamaged pallets for continued shipment.

  • Description: XPO Logistics contacted ERTS regarding one leaking 55-gallon DM containing hazardous product, RDL44LVOC. A contractor dispatched and observed an estimated 1-gallon release onto the wooden trailer floor in a 2â€™ x 3â€™ area as a result of improper packaging. Oil dry was applied to the release and the damaged, leaking drum was overpacked. Two drums were generated container the overpacked drum of product, the impacted oil dry and the impacted PPE. XPO will manage all waste generated from the response. No storm-drains, waterways, or soil were involved in this incident.

R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services, LC who dispatched a crew from First Call Environmental (FCE) to remediate the site. The crew utilized hand tools, neutralizing agent, and absorbents to collect all impacted materials in two (2) 55-gallon drums for disposal.

item.title: Report E-2025010054
item.description:
Report E-2025010054

Identified by scraper @ 2025-01-07T18:25:48+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-12-23
  • City: EGGENSTEIN GERMANY
  • State:
  • Report Type: Undeclared Shipment with no Release
  • Mode Of Transportation: Air
  • Carrier/Reporter: UNITED PARCEL SERVICE CO.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: UPS AIRLINES WAS NOTIFIED ONE AIR PACKAGE ORIGINATING FROM CHINA, TRANSITING THROUGH THE USA ON UPS AIRCRAFT HAD BEEN DELIVERED TO THE CONSIGNEE IN GERMANY CONTAINING A TOXIC BY INHALATION LIQUID FORBIDDEN FOR TRANSPORT. THE CONSIGNEE ORDERED CHEMICAL TRIMETHYLSILYLCYANID AT UCHEM INC, SHANGHAI, CHINA. ONCE THE PACKAGE WAS RECEIVED BY THE CONSIGNEE IN GERMANY, THEY DISCOVERED ALL DOCUMENTATION STATED NON-HAZARDOUS CHEMICAL MONOMETHYL ADIPATE HAD BEEN SHIPPED INSTEAD OF THE ORDERED TRIMETHYLSILYLCYANID CHEMICAL. THE TOXIC BY INHALATION LIQUID, FLAMMABLE WAS PACKAGED IN AN ALUMINUM BAG DESCRIBED AS MONOMETHYL ADIPATE CAS 627-91-8. THE OUTER FIBERBOARD BOX WAS NOT MARKED OR LABELLED WITH ANY DANGEROUS GOODS INDICATORS. UPON OPENING THE ALUMIMUM BAG, THE CONSIGNEE NOTED THE SMELL OF CYANIDE. THE 500 G BOTTLE INSIDE THE BAG HAD NO LABELS OR SIGNAGE INDICATING THE CONTENTS INSIDE THE BOTTLE. TESTS PERFORMED BY THE CONSIGNEE CONFIRMED TRIMETHYLSILYL CYANIDE, CAS 7677-24-9 WAS CONTAINED IN THE UNMARKED BOTTLE INSIDE THE ALUMINIM BAG DESCRIBED BY THE SHIPPER AS MONOMETHYL ADIPATE CAS 627-91-8. THE PACKAGE IS NO LONGER IN TRANSPORTATION BUT HAD PREVIOUSLY TRAVELED VIA AIRCRAFT FROM PVG TO ANC, ANC TO SDF, SDF TO CGN.

item.title: Report E-2025010061
item.description:
Report E-2025010061

Identified by scraper @ 2025-01-07T18:25:48+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-12-20
  • City: INCHEON KOREA
  • State:
  • Report Type: Undeclared Shipment with no Release
  • Mode Of Transportation: Air
  • Carrier/Reporter: UNITED PARCEL SERVICE CO.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: AT THE UPS FACILITY IN INCHEON, KOREA, X-RAY SCREENING OF ONE PACKAGE FROM THE USA TO CHINA WAS FOUND TO CONTAIN TRAYS OF LITHIUM ION BATTERIES. THE OUTER BOX DOES NOT HAVE ANY DANGEROUS GOODS MARKS OR LABELS. THERMAL LABEL AND INVOICE DESCRIBE CONTENTS AS BATTERIES. OPEN PACKAGE INSPECTION TO DETERMINE THE TYPE OF BATTERIES BEING SHIPPED REVEALS TRAYS OF HIGHSTAR 3.6V INR21700 - 40PS 14.4 WH - INR22/71 LI-ION 111824 BATTERIES. PRIOR TO THE UNDECLARED DISCOVERY THE PACKAGE WAS FLOWN ON UPS AIRCRAFT FROM SDF TO ANC, ANC TO ICN.

  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: On December 20, 2024, at 1402 ET, Emergency Response and Training Solutions (ERTS) was contacted by Roadrunner Transportation Services personnel in Romulus, MI regarding the release of Rectorseal SAM CL-3L Cleaner. The spill consisted of approximately 8 ounces of Rectorseal Sam CL-3L Cleaner (UN1993, 3, II), which spilled from 1-1 gallon metal can due to a loose lid during transit. The terminal stated there was no cleanup needed as whatever spilled had already dried up and evaporated upon discovery. Waste disposal is pending a response from the consignee as to whether they will accept the leaking containers or not.

item.description:

Identified by scraper @ 2025-01-07T18:25:48+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-12-10
  • City: CHICOPEE
  • State: MA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: XPO LOGISTICS, LLC
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: At 10:54 ET, XPO notified the Call Center of a cargo release at terminal XSX. It was reported that approximately 2 cups of Sodium hydroxide solid released from two 50-pound bags mesh plastic bags due to improper loading by previous terminal. The release impacted Dock #154. Call center initially advised terminal personnel they were able to clean up the spilled product due to initial overlooking of section 14 of the SDS. Upon further review of the SDS it was discovered that the material was class 8 corrosive, terminal was called and informed of the product classification, the call center was notified that the product had already been cleaned and stored away in a 10-gallon plastic drum. Service Center Manager was informed of the mistake and gave retroactive approval for terminal personnel to clean the spilled product. Waste label 223160-1 was created, one 10-gallon poly drum containing the cleaned-up product and two plastic mesh bags.

item.description:

  • City: KERNERSVILLE
  • State: NC
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident

  • Carrier/Reporter: XPO LOGISTICS, LLC
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0

  • Total Amount Of Damages: 6500
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: At 02:06 on 12/10, XPO-NWN contacted ERTS to report a spill of about 2 quarts of "Gardoclean S 5661" from a 54gal poly drum impacting the trailer floor. The drum was punctured by a forklift at BCO. ERTS confirmed the material to be a regulated corrosive and will dispatch a contractor to assist with cleanup. Contractors arrived onsite and confirmed approximately 10-gallons of UN3266 Gardoclean released due to forklift puncture. The product impacted the wooden trailer floor 10â€™x7â€™ and concrete floor 10â€™xâ€™8â€™. The contractor used citric acid to neutralize the release and used oil dri, absorbent pads, and boom to contain/clean-up the release. The contractors containerized impacted absorbent into (1) 55-gallon poly drum, impacted absorbents & PPE into (1) 55-gallon poly drum and overpack into (1) 85-gallon poly drum. The waste was staged onsite for terminal personnel to manage.

item.title: Report E-2025010051
item.description:
Report E-2025010051

Identified by scraper @ 2025-01-07T18:25:48+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-12-09
  • City: FIFE
  • State: WA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: XPO LOGISTICS, LLC
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: At 15:40 EST, ERTS was contacted by XPO Logistics (UTA) about a cargo release. It was reported that due to improper loading, approximately 3 gallons of Klean Strip Acetone (hazardous - UN1090) was released on the trailer; and 9 cans of Fuel -Denatured Alcohol (hazardous - UN1987) was refused by the Consignee. The caller stated that the released product was contained to the trailer floor. ERTS reviewed the SDS with the caller and they felt comfortable cleaning the release donning the proper PPE per SDS. The released product and 4 damaged cans of UN1090 - Acetone will be placed into a 20-gallon metal drum, while the 9 cans of UN1987 - Denatured Alcohol will be placed into a 35-gallon metal drum, and staged in OS&D. There were no drains, soils or waterways reported to have been impacted by the release. There is no regulatory reporting required for this release. ERTS will upload the BOL, SDS and create a waste container entry.

item.title: Report E-2025010046
item.description:
Report E-2025010046

Identified by scraper @ 2025-01-07T18:25:48+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-12-06
  • City: DENVER
  • State: CO
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: XPO LOGISTICS, LLC
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 24500
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: At 14:57 PM ET, UDV contacted the call center to report a spill that occurred over the road, near 5500 Lincoln St. in Denver, CO. The spill consists of approximately 75 gallons of a UN1719 corrosive liquid, trade name unknown, which spilled from 1-270 gallon plastic tote. The driver was cut off by another vehicle and had to make a sharp turn, causing the tote to suffer a large puncture across the middle. The driver stated the tote was properly secured and strapped in, and they believe the spill was due to package failure. The spill has impacted the floor of the trailer and has spilled out onto the asphalt below the trailer. The tote is no longer actively leaking. ERTS will dispatch for assistance. Contractors arrived onsite and confirmed approximately 250-gallons of UN1719 product released to a 180â€™x20â€™ area of the trailer floor, asphalt, concrete and drain due to load shift. The contractors cleaned the release with absorbents, recollected, and containerized the release into drums, (2) CUYD containing floor dry impacted with product, (2) 275-gallon totes containing impacted rinsewater from the drains, (2) 55-gallon plastic drums containing transferred product only, (1) 55-gallon plastic drum contained impacted PPE, debris, poly sheeting, floor dry, spent absorbents and straps and (1) 65-gallon metal drum containing impacted absorbents, trash bags, and PPE and (2) 55-gallon plastic drums containing cut up totes. The waste was picked up and taken to a waste management facility.

  • Description: Dayton Freight personnel observed an unknown amount of material released from two (2) 5-gallon metal pails due to an unknown cause resulting in the pails being crushed. The release material impacted the trailer floor. Dayton Freight personnel requested a contractor for assistance in cleaning up due to the corrosive nature of the material. The spent material was containerized it into two (2) 20-gallon poly drums. One drum contains 2 crushed pails, while the other contains an acid neutralizer and pallet chips. The generated waste was staged onsite at the terminal in a secure location. The generated waste will remain onsite for Dayton Freightâ€™s contracted hazardous waste vendor to coordinate disposal.

  • Description: At 2128 ET, Juan Franco with XPO notified ERTS of a cargo release at NMF. It was reported that approximately 20 gallons of BT0222-55 Cetamine V211 released from a 55-gallon DF due to a forklift puncture. The release impacted trailer #5634362 at dock door 76 and has been moved to the yard due to the overwhelming odor. ERTS will proceed to dispatch a contractor to the site to complete cleanup activities. An ETA will be provided once it is known. Contractors arrived onsite and confirmed approximately 50-gallons of UN2927 BT0222-55 Cetamine V211 released to a 15â€™x8â€™ area of the trailer floor and 100â€™x30â€™ and 10â€™x10â€™ area of the concrete due to forklift puncture. The contractors cleaned the release with absorbents, recollected, and containerized the release into drums, (1) 85-gallon metal drum containing overpacked damaged poly drum, spent absorbents and straps and (1) 65-gallon metal drum containing impacted absorbents, trash bags, and PPE. The waste was staged onsite for terminal personnel to manage.

item.description:
Report E-2024120507

Identified by scraper @ 2025-01-07T00:58:33+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-12-30
  • City: YPSILANTI
  • State: MI
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: R & L CARRIERS, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 5000
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: On December 30, 2024, one (1) 50-gallon drum of UN1760 was damaged by a forklift and released approximately five (5) gallons of product to the pallet and trailer floor. R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services, LC who dispatched a crew from First Call Environmental (FCE) to remediate the impacted site. The crew containerized the damaged drum in one (1) 95-gallon overpack. FCE utilized granular absorbents and hand tools to remediate the surfaces and collected all waste in one (1) 55-gallon drum.

  • City: LOUISVILLE

  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0

  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: AT THE UPS WORLDPORT FACILITY IN LOUISVILLE, KENTUCKY, INTERCEPTION OF TWO AIR PACKAGES WAS MADE. UPON INSPECTION OF THE INNER CONTENTS EACH PACKAGE CONTAINED TWO LUMINOUS PRO 2 LED POWER BANKS, 38.5 WH. THERE ARE NO DANGEROUS GOODS MARKS OR LABELS ON THE OUTER PACKAGING. ADDITIONAL TRACKING NUMBER TO ANOTHER CONSIGNEE IN CALIFORNIA, USA IS 1ZH9199D1203548932. THESE PACKAGES WERE SHIPPED USING UPS ACCOUNT NUMBER H9199D, ACTIVATESWAG, 3200 NW 112TH AVE C4, DORAL FL 33172-5013. PRIOR TO THE UNDECLARED DISCOVERY, THE PACKAGES WERE FLOWN ON UPS AIRCRAFT FROM MIA TO SDF.

  • Description: Upon arrival at the destination terminal, the pail was discovered leaking inside the trailer. The pails on the skid were secured using a dunnage pallet but during transit, the dunnage pallet moved slightly, allowing the pail to fall off of the skid it was sitting on. As a result, the bottom of the pail cracked causing a small release of material. The material was absorbed using absorbent material and placed into a proper receptable along with the damaged pail for proper disposal. The package specifications were not able to be safely obtained.

item.description:

Identified by scraper @ 2025-01-07T00:58:33+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-12-17
  • City: HUBER HEIGHTS
  • State: OH
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: DAYTON FREIGHT LINES, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: Dayton Freight personnel observed approximately one (1) gallon of material released from one (1) 55-gallon metal drum due to a packaging defect that resulted in the drum leaking. The released material impacted the trailer floor. Dayton Freight personnel deployed granular absorbents to the impacted area and gathered the spent material and containerized it into two (2) 5-gallon poly drums. One (1) 85-gallon poly drum was used to containerize the 55-gallon drum. The generated waste was staged onsite at the terminal in a secure location. The generated waste will remain onsite for Dayton Freightâ€™s contracted hazardous waste vendor to coordinate disposal.

  • Description: NOTIFIED ABOUT A LEAKING PACKAGE AND A RESPONDER BROUGHT A PACKAGE BACK TO THE PSC FOR PROCESSING. UPON OPENING THE PACKAGE RESPONDER NOTICED IT WAS FULL OF 5PK NICOTINE VAPES. RESPONDER DID A 6 SIDED CHECK AND NOTICED NO DIAMOND LABELS OR HAZMAT INFORMATION ON PACKAGE AND NOTIFIED RMP ABOUT A POSSIBLE UNDECLARED. LITHIUM ION BATTERIES CONTAINED IN EQUIPMENT

item.description:
Report E-2025010049

  • City: POMPANO BEACH
  • State: FL
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: XPO LOGISTICS, LLC
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: At 07:14 EST, ERTS was contacted by XPO Logistics (NPB) about a cargo release. It was reported that due to improper loading, approximately 5 pounds Royal Blend NP AE (hazardous - UN3262) was released. The caller stated that the released product was contained to the trailer and dock floor. ERTS reviewed the SDS with the caller and they felt comfortable cleaning the release donning the proper PPE per SDS (Nick Fletcher - Service Center Mgr. was advised the terminal wants to clean it themselves). The released product and damaged bag will be placed into a 5-gallon poly drum and staged in OS&D. There were no drains, soils or waterways reported to have been impacted by the release.

item.title: Report X-2025010033
item.description:
Report X-2025010033

Identified by scraper @ 2025-01-07T00:58:33+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-12-07
  • City: LYNNFIELD
  • State: MA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: UNITED PARCEL SERVICE
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: THE PACKAGE WAS UNLOADED, PALED AND SORTED TO THE NORTH SORT AISLE. THE SORTER NOTICED A SMALL AMOUNT OF LIQUID COMING OUT FROM THE CORNER OF THE BOX. HE LEFT THE AREA AND NOTIFIED HIS SUPERVISOR. THE SUPERVISOR THEN CALLED FOR A DESIGNATED RESPONDER. THE RESPONDER FOLLOWING THE DECISION TREE AND APPROPRIATE RESPONSE SHEET PLACED THE LEAKING PACKAGE INTO A LINED SPILL TUB. THE RESPONDER THEN FOLLOWING THE EQUIPMENT DECONTAMINATION CHECKLIST DECONTAMINATED THE EQUIPMENT. THE PACKAGE WAS THEN TRANSPORTED TO THE DMP AREA FOR FURTHER PROCESSING. IT WAS THERE THE PACKAGE WAS DISCOVERED TO BE UNDECLARED.

ERTS reviewed the SDS with the terminal, who stated they placed the pails and the shrink wrap in (1)35-gallon metal drum with plastic lining.
